In the heart of Nigeria’s active history, there’s a story that speaks of visionaries who dared to dream when the odds were stacked against them. This is the tale of Wema Bank, Nigeria’s oldest indigenous bank, whose journey spans over 80 years and is rooted in an audacious dream. From humble beginnings in a bungalow in Lagos, Nigeria in the 1940s to becoming Africa’s digital banking pioneer, Wema Bank’s legacy is built on one core principle - RESILIENCE. This article takes us through the story of how Wema Bank’s transformational journey began in 1945.THE FOUNDERS’ DREAM: THE DREAM THAT DEFIED THE IMPOSSIBLEIn the 1940s, when Nigeria was under colonial rule, few could imagine a Nigerian-owned bank would exist. The idea seemed far-fetched, an impossible dream. But In a bungalow located in Ebute metta, Lagos, Nigeria began the story of Nigeria’s oldest indigenous bank and most resilient, Wema Bank, where an ambitious young man from the Okupe family of the Agbonmagbe Ruling House, the Late Chief Matthew Adekoya Okupe, had a vision—to establish an indigenous Bank that was built to last and fortified to serve the people for years to come.At the time, it seemed impractical and unattainable, but Chief Matthew Adekoya Okupe, a man who started his career earning a modest 20 shillings as salary, saw a future where Nigerians controlled their own financial destiny. He wasn’t alone in this vision. Alongside him were his wife, Mrs. Reginald Adekoya Okupe (R.A.O.), and Reverend Alabi, three dreamers who believed that an indigenous Nigerian bank was not just possible—it was necessary. Together, these three exceeded all expectations and did the impossible, establishing the only indigenous bank to have stood the test of time for eight decades, surviving pre-Independence Nigeria, the digital evolution and all eras which significantly restructured the banking industry, to standing strong in the 21st century as an industry leader and a pioneer of digital banking and innovation. This Bank is Wema Bank, Plc. and its birth name was Agbonmagbe Bank limited. THE ROAD TO AGBONMAGBE BANK LIMITEDIn 1939, Chief Matthew Adekoya Okupe built Agbonmagbe Lodge, a building that still stands prominently today at the foot of the ramp leading into Yaba, Lagos, Nigeria from the third mainland bridge. In this timeless white bungalow (a place where dreams were turned into action), Chief Okupe birthed the vision of Nigeria’s oldest indigenous bank, joining forces with his partner in love and partners in business, R.A.O. and Reverend Alabi, to bring the vision into reality.Out of context, one would wonder what was so special about that dream. After all, majority of the Nigerian Banking industry of today is populated with indigenous banks. A correct observation—one which unironically highlights the beauty of that dream. The intricacies of the colonial era are no news to any adult in today’s world. Before Nigeria gained independence in 1960, the country had lived under the British colonial rule for decades, using the British currencies, adopting the services they provided and existing under their governance. In such an era, the idea of an indigenous bank may have seemed unrealistic; “It won’t last”, “How will you do it?”, “Forget it”, “It is not even possible”; but it was. All that was needed was a group of determined and resourceful individuals ready to break through and do the impossible. Against skepticism, the founders pressed on, knowing that the foundation they were laying would become a cornerstone for future generations. And today, it is now known as Nigeria’s oldest, longest surviving, most resilient and innovative bank, Wema Bank,As the Agbonmagbe Bank Limited received its license to operate on May 2, 1945, a new chapter in Nigeria’s banking history began; marking the beginning of Wema Bank’s story.CHALLENGES AND RESILIENCE: A TEST OF STRENGTHAs one of the thriving banks at the time, Agbonmagbe Bank Limited had earned the patronage of many Nigerians on individual, business and institutional levels. One of such stakeholders was the Western Nigeria Marketing Board, who had a fixed deposit of 200,000 pounds with the bank. However, No success story is without its trials, and for Wema Bank, the challenges came early. Despite flourishing in its early years, Agbonmagbe Bank faced its first major hurdle in 1968 when the government required banks to recapitalize to meet the minimum requirement over a certain period. Unfortunately, this development came at a crucial point in the journey of Agbonmagbe Bank Limited, resulting in the bank being unable to meet up with its plans for raising foreign investments within the stipulated period. In an unexpected twist of fate, The Western Nigeria Marketing Board converted their fixed deposit of 200,000 pounds into shares, making the Board the majority shareholder in the bank and allowing the bank to keep on—only, this time, with the Board owning the bank. This lifechanging turn of events left Chief Matthew Okupe and his partners with a tough decision to make: hand over the reins or risk seeing their dream disappear. They chose to let the legacy continue, even if it meant losing control. This pivotal moment ensured that the bank would survive and continue its mission.THE TOUGH DECISIONS ON THE ROAD TO SUCCESS: FROM AGBONMAGBE TO WEMA BANK PLCFor years after its establishment, Agbonmagbe Bank Limited thrived, providing financial services from two small rooms in Agbonmagbe Lodge, fortified with secure windows that kept documents and funds safe in a 4-foot safe high that stands as a banking industry relic today, still at Agbonmagbe Lodge. Those two rooms in Agbonmagbe Lodge served as the first branch, subsequently expanding to branches in Ebute-metta, Sagamu, Abeokuta and Ijebu-Igbo.In 1969, Agbonmagbe Bank Limited evolved into Wema Bank Limited, a name that would eventually become synonymous with resilience and vision. As Nigeria moved into a new era, so too did the bank. As digital evolution took effect on the economy in the later parts of the 1900s, industries were gradually forced to restructure and adapt over the coming years, and institutions that were unable to act fast and implement the necessary adjustments had no choice but to go into extinction. Hundreds of financial institutions fizzled out, but Wema Bank remained resilient, surviving through the decades and continuing to deliver financial services as a private entity. Sadly, Chief Matthew Okupe passed on in 1984, leaving behind the profound legacy of Nigeria’s oldest indigenous bank, a legacy which has continued to live on into its best decades.By 1987, Wema Bank Limited became Wema Bank plc, becoming a public limited liability company that became listed on the Nigerian Stock Exchange in 1990 under the symbol WEMABANK. By February 2001, the Bank was granted a Universal Banking License by the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN). By 2005, after the Soludo-led recapitalization exercise, Wema Bank merged with the then National Bank of Nigeria, acquiring National Bank and retaining the name, Wema Bank plc.Economic turbulence in the early 2000s led to dramatic restructuring. This time, the decision was to scale back and focus on regaining strength. By 2009, Wema Bank received its regional banking authorisation and took a step back to refuel, knowing that it had the resilience to come back stronger. BECOMING WEMA BANK PLC - A REBIRTH & THE RISE OF DIGITAL INNOVATIONIn the face of adversity, Wema Bank didn’t just survive—it reinvented itself. After years of restructuring, the bank rebranded itself as Nigeria’s most innovative bank, embracing technology as the future of banking. By 2015, Wema Bank regained its national banking license, ushering in a new chapter of growth and transformation. Slowly but surely, Wema Bank rebuilt itself over six years, restrategising with a new focus on innovation, customer centricity and transformation, thus rebranding from simply being Nigeria’s oldest indigenous bank and most resilient bank to also becoming the Bank we all know today as Nigeria’s most innovative bank. Nigeria’s oldest indigenous bank soon began to spearhead a digital transformation in the banking industry, going beyond the Wema Mobile App, which stood on par with other mobile banking apps in the industry, to pioneering ALAT, the first fully digital bank in Africa. This unexpected yet groundbreaking move shook the financial services industry, introducing a new era of banking where Nigerians could bank end-to-end without ever having to visit a physical branch. In its true nature of breaking new ground since birth, Wema Bank, within the past decade, has launched several industry firsts into the industry, leveraging its wealth of experience in the industry and its drive for innovation, futuristic and customer centric banking to discover new areas of need to provide solutions, meet needs and make remarkab

Wema Bank Kicks Off 80th Anniversary Celebration with “80 Years of Spreading Love” Valentine Campaign

paragraphs: Wema Bank has kicked off its 80th-anniversary celebration with the launch of its “80 Years of Spreading Love” Valentine campaign, running from February 1st to 28th, 2024. This campaign is the first in a series of exciting activities leading up to the bank’s grand 80th anniversary on May 2, 2025, and is designed to reward customer loyalty, strengthen connections, and create unforgettable experiences through 80 Acts of Love.With rewards tailored for every customer segment, Wema Bank is rolling out ?11,000,000 in cash prizes, gift cards, movie tickets, spa treatments, fitness access, and Uber vouchers for young professionals and students. Women and families will enjoy free SARA health consultations, business promotions, and networking opportunities, while Diaspora and Prestige customers can access discounted loans, cashback rewards, and priority banking services. SMEs and entrepreneurs aren’t left out, as they’ll benefit from free delivery services, business training sessions, Meta advert credits, and promotional support, alongside up to 15% off CIG Motors products and 5% off Green Asset products with free StarTimes decoders and a six-month subscription.The “80 Years of Spreading Love” campaign is just the beginning of a year-long celebration honoring the customers who have journeyed with Wema Bank over the past eight decades. To take part in the rewards, customers simply need to download ALAT and follow Wema Bank on social media for updates on exclusive benefits throughout the season of love.

Wema Bank has kicked off its 80th-anniversary celebration with the launch of its “80 Years of Spreading Love” Valentine campaign, running from February 1st to 28th, 2024. This campaign is the first in a series of exciting activities leading up to the bank’s grand 80th anniversary on May 2, 2025, and is designed to reward customer loyalty, strengthen connections, and create unforgettable experiences through 80 Acts of Love.

With rewards tailored for every customer segment, Wema Bank is rolling out ?11,000,000 in cash prizes, gift cards, movie tickets, spa treatments, fitness access, and Uber vouchers for young professionals and students. Women and families will enjoy free SARA health consultations, business promotions, and networking opportunities, while Diaspora and Prestige customers can access discounted loans, cashback rewards, and priority banking services. SMEs and entrepreneurs aren’t left out, as they’ll benefit from free delivery services, business training sessions, Meta advert credits, and promotional support, alongside up to 15% off CIG Motors products and 5% off Green Asset products with free StarTimes decoders and a six-month subscription.

The “80 Years of Spreading Love” campaign is just the beginning of a year-long celebration honoring the customers who have journeyed with Wema Bank over the past eight decades. To take part in the rewards, customers simply need to download ALAT and follow Wema Bank on social media for updates on exclusive benefits throughout the season of love.

title: WEMA Bank at 80 FAQs
meta_description: Here are some frequently asked questions about Wema Bank at 80.

headings.text: Bank Verification Number – Code To Check Your BVN
Loan Rate Calculators – Mortgage, Car Loan or Any Loan
Q: What is the significance of Wema Bank’s 80th anniversary?
Q: How has Wema Bank evolved over the past 80 years?
Q: What makes Wema Bank unique in Nigeria’s banking industry?

A: Wema Bank’s 80th anniversary is a celebration of resilience, innovation, and excellence. Since its establishment in 1945 as Agbonmagbe Bank, the bank has transformed into Nigeria’s longest-surviving indigenous bank, pioneering digital banking and financial inclusion while empowering individuals, businesses, and communities.

A: Wema Bank started as Agbonmagbe Bank, rebranded to Wema Bank Limited in 1969, and has since grown from a regional to a national bank, achieving a series of milestones, including the launch of ALAT—Africa’s first fully digital bank. The bank has consistently adapted to industry trends, expanded its services, and championed groundbreaking innovations in finance and technology.

A: Wema Bank is Nigeria’s most innovative bank, leading digital transformation with ALAT, the first fully digital bank in Africa. The bank has also introduced Phygital branches, empowering customers with self-service banking while maintaining human touchpoints. Beyond banking, Wema Bank is deeply committed to entrepreneurship, financial inclusion, and social impact through programs like SARA by Wema, Hackaholics, and the FGN/ALAT Digital Skillnovation Program.

A: Wema Bank has played a pivotal role in advancing digital banking in Nigeria with the launch of ALAT in 2017. ALAT revolutionized the industry by offering a seamless, fully digital banking experience—enabling instant account opening, virtual cards, automated savings, and flexible loans without visiting a physical branch. Wema Bank has continued to innovate, integrating technology to improve financial access and convenience.

A: Wema Bank is committed to empowering individuals, SMEs, and startups through various initiatives, including:SARA by Wema: Focused on women’s empowerment, providing financial support, training, and business development. Hackaholics: A tech-based ideathon fostering innovation among young entrepreneurs and developers.FGN/ALAT Digital Skillnovation Program: Equipping Nigerian youths with critical digital skills for future careers.NYSC/ALAT Accelerator Program: Supporting corps members with financial literacy, business funding, and job readiness training.

A: Wema Bank is at the forefront of financial inclusion, leveraging ALAT to provide accessible banking services to underserved and unbanked populations across Nigeria. The bank has also introduced branchless banking solutions and digital products to ensure that banking services reach rural communities, SMEs, and non-traditional banking customers. Through ALAT’s ingenuity, Wema Bank has birthed innovative solutions like ALAT for Business, ALAT Pay, ALAT Xplore, and CoopHub, expanding financial access for businesses, young Nigerians, cooperatives, and digital-first customers.

A: Wema Bank aligns with the United Nations’ Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), driving impactful programs in financial inclusion, education, gender equality, and environmental sustainability. Initiatives like SARA by Wema, ALAT Summer Internship, and Sounds of ALAT promote economic empowerment, youth development, and the creative industry, while the bank’s eco-friendly initiatives advocate for climate action.

A: Wema Bank has achieved several milestones, including:Rebranding from Agbonmagbe Bank to Wema Bank in 1969. Becoming a national bank in 2015 after upgrading from a regional status.Launching ALAT, Africa’s first fully digital bank, in 2017.Pioneering Phygital banking for seamless digital and in-branch experiences.Introducing ALAT Xplore, Nigeria’s first licensed banking app for teenagers, empowering young Nigerians with financial literacy and banking access.Winning multiple awards for innovation, customer service, and digital excellence.

A: As Wema Bank celebrates 80 years, it remains committed to driving digital transformation, expanding its banking solutions, and creating even greater financial opportunities. With plans to scale ALAT beyond Nigeria, enhance fintech collaborations, and invest in more sustainable banking solutions, Wema Bank is shaping the future of finance for the next generation.

A: Customers, partners, and stakeholders can be part of the Wema Bank at 80 celebrations by engaging in special anniversary events, sharing their experiences with Wema Bank over the years, and exploring exclusive banking offers. Follow Wema Bank on social media (@wemabank, @alat_ng) and visit our website for updates on the 80th-anniversary celebrations.

title: WEMA Bank Accounts and Services - Tailored for Your Financial Success
meta_description: Discover a range of accounts and services at WEMA Bank, tailored for your financial success. From customer loans to savings accounts, find the perfect solution for your needs in Lagos, Nigeria.
paragraphs: Discover a wealth of information, insights, and tools designed to optimize your banking experience. Explore the features, benefits, and tips to make the most out of your accounts and services, ensuring a tailored and efficient financial journey.

Wema Current Account is your gateway to seamless transactions, convenient savings, and exclusive benefits. Manage your money on the go with our user-friendly ALAT app, enjoy zero account opening fees, and access a variety of credit facilities. Switch to Wema today and experience banking the way it should be.

More than just saving, with our savings accounts we help you move
              even closer to your goals every day.
Unburden yourself from logistical minutiae with access to a dedicated team to handle everyday affairs and special requests, from travel arrangements to asset management.

Customers can carry out banking transactions by simply dialing the short code *945# to experience an array of functions which include checking account balances on the Go, Quick funds transfer, Instant self and third party airtime recharge, bills payment and many more via their mobile phones.

We at Wema bank understand the need to connect Nigerians in Diaspora with their loved ones here at home and vice-versa, that is why our customers can enjoy the Send and Receive options via Western Union Money Transfer from all our branches nationwide. Our services are convenient, fast and secure.

MoneyGram transfer service is available in all Wema Bank branches. We have a solid partnership with MoneyGram which allows our customers the luxury of collecting their payments from friends and family in approximately 350,000 locations in over 200 countries all over the world.

meta_description: Grow your wealth with WEMA Bank's Savings Account. Benefit from competitive interest rates and convenient features, making saving easy and rewarding in Lagos, Nigeria.
paragraphs: More than just saving, with our savings accounts we help you move even closer to your goals every day.

Everyone should be able to use a bank to make their lives easier, so we designed the Easy Life Account for anyone who doesn’t have any kind of identification but still wants to enjoy the benefits of owning a bank account. For basic banking, it doesn’t get easier than this.Learn More

You too can own a bank account; whether your means of identification is generally acceptable or not. No one should be left behind; be it artisans or fishermen. The Tier 2 Account is made just for you. You can open one at any Wema Bank branch or on ALAT.Learn More

For casual saving, nothing beats the simplicity of the Wema Personal Savings account. Put money away at your convenience and we’ll pay you interest as long as you don’t withdraw more than four times every month.Learn More

Our range of Domiciliary Account products give you the opportunity to choose the right option so you can conveniently carry out foreign currency transactions wherever you may be, and whenever you want.Learn More
Royal kiddies account is a special account that enables children get an early start to financial freedom at WEMA Bank and it is designed for children between ages 0 to 12 years.Learn More

Designed to fit the lifestyles of teenagers and young adults, the Wema Purple Account is free of the strings of a minimum balance. It also comes with free bank drafts for paying fees and a debit card.Learn More

Our premium bouquet of products and services will ensure you never get disconnected from carrying out financial transactions back home in Nigeria while you are abroad. The need for you to enjoy convenient, safe, and efficient banking services is at the centre of our proposition to you.Learn More

Achieve your savings goals on time every time with the Wema SmartSave Account. Choose what you’ll like to save for and earn interest on your money every month for up to three years. We’ll even pay you bonus interest if you achieve your monthly savings goal consistently.Learn More

Watch your financial harvest flourish with Wema Salary Savings Account. Your salary finds fertile ground, earning competitive interest while offering convenient access and control. Plant the seeds of your financial future today.Learn More

Maybe a Current Account is not for you but you want to enjoy some flexibility on your Savings Account; Wema Treasure Account (WTA) is what you need. Wema Treasure Account is a hybrid savings account. It operates with some flexibility of a Current Account with minimal restrictions, allowing third party transactions and accruing interest on account balances.Learn More

Wema WTA Non-Individual is more than just a savings account. It's a financial tool designed to empower your business. Enjoy attractive interest rates, convenient third-party transactions through personalized cheque books, and minimal restrictions on withdrawals. Streamline your financial operations, improve cash flow management, and take your business to the next level with Wema.Learn More

title: Wema Bank

headings.text: Secure Your Future, Grow Your Wealth
Why Open A Fixed Deposit Account?
More about our Fixed Deposit Account

paragraphs: Explore the stability and growth potential of your finances with our tailored fixed deposit solutions. Learn about competitive rates, flexible terms, and the assurance of a secure investment.

Need to grow your money in a short time between 30 -180 days or more? Then, you should try our fixed deposits account. It enables you to Invest a lump sum with us safely for a specific period of up to 180 days and earn a pre-agreed interest rate. While we’re growing your investment, you’ll be able to use all our electronic banking channels free of charge. Investments can be cashed out with interest or reinvested.

With our fixed deposit account, you can grow your money because the account lets you invest a specific amount of money for a fixed period of time, at an agreed interest rate. At the end of the agreed period (tenor), the investment can either be rolled over (re-invested) or liquidated (returned to customer) with the interest amount earned. Example: You can invest N100,000 in your fixed deposits account for 180 days, at an agreed interest rate, and at the end of the tenor, you can choose to roll it over for another 180 days or withdraw your investment or move it into your savings account or any other account with us. It is that simple.

Customers can carry out banking transactions by simply dialing the short code *945# to experience an array of functions which include checking account balances on the Go, Quick funds transfer, Instant self and third party airtime recharge, bills payment and many more via their mobile phones.

We at Wema bank understand the need to connect Nigerians in Diaspora with their loved ones here at home and vice-versa, that is why our customers can enjoy the Send and Receive options via Western Union Money Transfer from all our branches nationwide. Our services are convenient, fast and secure.

MoneyGram transfer service is available in all Wema Bank branches. We have a solid partnership with MoneyGram which allows our customers the luxury of collecting their payments from friends and family in approximately 350,000 locations in over 200 countries all over the world.
Our Recruitment Process
Wema Bank. All Rights Reserved.

title: WEMA Bank Credit Card - Flexible Credit Solutions for You
meta_description: Explore flexible credit solutions with WEMA Bank's Credit Card. Enjoy convenient access to credit, tailored to your needs, and experience financial freedom in Lagos, Nigeria.

headings.text: How to use Wema credit card

paragraphs: The Wema Bank credit card is a Naira-denominated revolving loan facility that allows payments on POS and Web. It also allows cash withdrawals on the ATM domestically as well as internationally, subject to regulatory limits and charges.
Card Fee (Joining Fee)
Whether Cash-backed or Clean; these Wema Bank Credit Cards are made especially for you. Learn More
All Credit cards are issued under the Visa Card brand. You have great options to choose from: Classic, Gold, and Platinum; either denominated in Naira or USD. Learn More
Take the world with you with our USD-denominated Visa Card, usable worldwide. Learn More

Master your money with confidence using your Wema Credit Card. Our comprehensive guide empowers you to use your Wema Credit Card like a pro. Learn about smart spending habits, managing your credit score, and avoiding unnecessary fees. Take control of your finances and unlock the benefits of responsible credit card use. Learn More

paragraphs: Our range of Debit cards allows you to carry out everyday transactions easily such as payments on POS and Web. It also allows local and international cash withdrawals on the ATM, subject to regulatory limits and charges.
Get access to your money anywhere with the Wema Debit MasterCard. Make purchases at local merchant outlets anywhere in Nigeria. Learn More

Access your money anywhere in Nigeria with the Wema Debit Verve Card, which includes making purchases for goods and services at local merchant outlets (POS, Web) in Nigeria. You can make withdrawals at any ATM in Nigeria. Learn More

Access your money anywhere in Nigeria with the Wema Debit Visa Card, which includes making purchases for goods and services at local merchant outlets (POS, Web) in Nigeria. You can make withdrawals at any ATM in Nigeria. Learn More

paragraphs: Get a Prepaid Card for better financial control. Top up money, pay bills, and manage your spending the smart way.

A prepaid card allows you to spend whatever amount of money is stored on the card. Once the balance is used up, you can reload the card online, or at any of our branch offices closest to you. Prepaid cards are issued by banks and branded by major payment companies, including Visa, MasterCard, and Verve.
A prepaid card is as good as cash and sometimes even better:
Take your easy transactions, bill payments, etcetera to the next level with a prepaid card. Apply For a Prepaid Card Now
FEATURED PREPAID CARDS

A smart and convenient way to manage your bills and daily expenses is through the use of the Wema Utility Prepaid ATM Card. You can get a card for your teenage child, your nanny, your chef, your driver, or people under your pay list. Besides convenience, when you use the Wema Utility Prepaid Card, you are sure your primary bank account is not exposed to the risk of internet fraud or physical theft.

Wema Utility Prepaid Cards are a wallet-based naira-denominated Verve Card. As a prepaid card, you are expected to preload the value you anticipate spending. Wema Utility Prepaid Cards presents the most convenient loading and reloading functionality, as it can be loaded by fund transfer through any e-banking channel. Learn More About Wema Utility Card

A Visa USD Travel Card or Travel Utility Card is a USD-denominated ATM Card that you can take with you anywhere in the world and that helps you manage all your travel expenses. You can pre-load your travel card and take it for your shopping sprees and travel errands, anywhere in the world.

Unlike other cards, the Travel Utility card is prepaid which means that you will have to load money on the card to use it. The card is linked to a virtual prepaid account so that all transactions made with the card are reflected instantly on the prepaid card account. This card works everywhere your debit card would work. Meaning that it is accepted wherever Visa is around the world. Learn More About Travel Utility Card
Ready To Get A Prepaid Card?
Take your easy transactions, bill payments, etcetera to the next level with a prepaid card. Apply For a Prepaid Card Now

title: WEMA Bank Personal Loan - Quick and Flexible Financing Options
meta_description: Explore quick and flexible financing options with WEMA Bank's Personal Loan. Access funds for personal needs with ease and convenience in Lagos, Nigeria.

headings.text: How long do I have to repay the loan?
Do I have to receive my salary through your bank to be eligible for the loan?
How much do I need to earn to qualify for the loan?
If I have a loan running with another bank, can I transfer it to WEMA Bank?
What is the security or collateral for this loan?
If I have a loan running, can I Top up if I require additional funds?
Can I pay down the loan before maturity?

paragraphs: Personal Loan is a loan facility currently available to employees who operate a Salary Current or Savings Account with Wema Bank. This product is also available for formally employed staff of companies/employers pre-approved by Wema Bank and groups of salary earners under an association. With this product, you can cover medical bills, purchase a car, make home improvements, give your side hustle a little boost, pay for training to improve yourself, and do so much more!
The personal loan will be disbursed into a salary account domiciled with the Bank.
In case you need an instant loan, check out ALAT instant loan
The WEMA Bank USSD code for loans in Nigeria is *945*65#. Simply dial *945*65# and follow the prompts to get loans in Nigeria from WEMA Bank.

lists: Available to existing salary account holders, based on salary domiciliation.
New customers, will in addition to salary domiciliation, provide evidence of consistent salary payment for the most recent 3 months.
The maximum loan amount is 7 multiples of net monthly salary, subject to a maximum of N4 million
Maximum loan tenor of 24 months.
Loan Top-up available after 6 months of regular monthly down payments.
Available to confirmed employees only.
Apply for loans & overdrafts at the convenience of your office.
Short turnaround time for loan & overdraft disbursement (48 hours).
Access to mobile & Internet Banking services.

title: WEMA Bank School Fees Advance - Convenient Financing for Education
meta_description: Secure convenient financing for education with WEMA Bank's School Fees Advance. Access funds to cover school fees and related expenses, ensuring a smooth educational journey.

headings.text: Requirements of a School fees advance

paragraphs: School Fees Advance is a short-term financing package designed to meet the financial needs of parents/guardians when their school fees obligation falls due. Permanently employed individuals whose salary accounts are domiciled  with the bank, Self Employed with proven capacity  and character to repay

School Fees Advance is a loan facility is designed to finance the payment of your child’s/ward’s school fees for schools/institutions in Nigeria and the diaspora. This facility is available to permanently employed individuals whose salary accounts are domiciled  with the bank, Self Employed with proven capacity  and character to repay

Life happens, but you can depend on us for a quick loan to take care of the things that are important to you, like the future of your loved ones. Speak to us about an advance of up to 10 million Naira for school fees.

School fees advance enables people undergoing different kinds and levels of formal education access to funds necessary for the completion of such study. Expenses ranging from costs of required stationeries, school fees, accommodation, as well as other expenses required by the students in need are covered by these loans. These facilities are majorly not known by many students, and for the selected few who know about them, processing them is unknown of them.

School fees advance like other loan facilities come with their terms and conditions of the acquisition. Eligible students, primarily students who have difficulty sourcing funds for their education would need to further meet some requirements before being through the process of loan obtainment.

Pursuant to the Stamp Duty Act Cap 58, Laws of the Federation of Nigeria 2004 (as amended), the Finance Act 2019 (as amended) and the Press release of the Federal Inland Revenue Service (FIRS), on payment and collection of Stamp Duty taxes, the bank shall deduct and remit, as required, all Stamp Duty taxes on the principal amount of the facility and related dutiable instruments.

title: WEMA Bank Salary Based Loan - Quick and Flexible Financing Options
meta_description: Explore quick and flexible financing options with WEMA Bank's Salary Based Loan. Access funds to meet your needs with ease and convenience in Nigeria.
paragraphs: ALAT Salary loan is for Salaried individuals whose  companies are enlisted with the  bank. It is a fast, convenient and reliable way  of accessing funds anywhere using  a mobile device or a computer.
Salary earners will be able to receive a minimum of #50,000 and up to #4,000,000 within hours and will repay in 12 months

The process of getting the salary-based loan is entirely online – on the ALAT app or web page – and begins with downloading the app from Android or IOS app store for new customers and a simple login with a click on the ‘Loan’ icon for ALAT registered customers on the ALAT app or web page.

To ensure that customers have a hitch-free registration process, the ALAT app has been updated to include a video run-through of the process of registration at the sign-up page. Customers can also get a simple explainer of each step of the registration process by clicking on the ‘I’ icon on each page of the app.

Also, for customers to have financial confidence and freedom, ALAT has introduced a zero balance. This means that customers can withdraw their money to the last kobo and there will be no charges should any customer maintain a zero balance on their account.

headings.text: In Need Of A Car Loan?

paragraphs: Vehicle Finance provides asset finance availability to individuals who wish to acquire and enjoy new vehicles, Tokunbo vehicles, and pre-owned vehicles of their choice. This product is available for employed staff of companies, self-employed individuals with a steady income from their business venture, and Groups of Salary earners under an association.
Car Loan enables you to own a car today for as low as N195,000 monthly payment!

We are excited to announce the "Easy Buy Finance" scheme, a vehicle finance scheme in partnership with Choice International Group (CIG) Motors aimed at assisting you to buy GAC vehicles with ease and at affordable prices with a flexible repayment plan.
This facility is customized for our salary savings or current account customers to buy motor vehicles. Features

Whether it’s your first car or you want to upgrade to a higher model, the WEMA Bank Auto Loans enables you to drive your dream car, while you repay conveniently. If you are on this table, we have your dream car covered!
Click Here To Indicate Interest

title: Wema Bank

headings.text: Digital or Internet Banking or E-Banking

paragraphs: Do you want to experience banking from the comfort of your home, at work, or abroad? A secure way to access your accounts, manage payments, check your statements, and much more, 24 hours a day.
Unleashing the Power of Online Banking with Wema.
Easy access to your account(s) from anywhere in the world.
Online real-time account monitoring facility.
The convenience of conducting banking transactions from the comfort of home/office.
Guaranteed security for all your online transactions.
Easy Access to bank information and products.
An effective, cheaper, and easier way for our customers to communicate with banks.

Wema Bank offers a wide range of Digital Solution products designed to cater to different needs, from personal finance management (ALAT) to business payment collections (Paydirect) and even industry-specific solutions like hospital and school management.
Streamline your school operations and empower informed decision-making with Wema Bank's comprehensive School Management solution.
Streamline your business operations and boost sales with Wema Bank's innovative Wema POS terminals, your one-stop shop for secure and convenient payments.
WemaCollect is our cutting-edge solution that can be customised to meet your specific revenue collection needs. The solution is a robust real-time and highly secure electronic collection solution.
Boost your sales and simplify collections with AlatPay, Wema Bank's secure and flexible online payment gateway.
WemaRemitYour secure and efficient e-courier service for delivering funds and schedules to bank accounts and relevant bodies.

Customers can carry out banking transactions by simply dialing the short code *945# to experience an array of functions which include checking account balances on the Go, Quick funds transfer, Instant self and third party airtime recharge, bills payment and many more via their mobile phones.

We at Wema bank understand the need to connect Nigerians in Diaspora with their loved ones here at home and vice-versa, that is why our customers can enjoy the Send and Receive options via Western Union Money Transfer from all our branches nationwide. Our services are convenient, fast and secure.

MoneyGram transfer service is available in all Wema Bank branches. We have a solid partnership with MoneyGram which allows our customers the luxury of collecting their payments from friends and family in approximately 350,000 locations in over 200 countries all over the world.
Our Recruitment Process
Wema Bank. All Rights Reserved.
purpleconnect@wemabank.com
54 Marina, Lagos Island Lagos State Nigeria
© Wema Bank. All Rights Reserved.

Do you want to experience banking from the comfort of your home, at work, or abroad? A secure way to access your accounts, manage payments, check your statements, and much more, 24 hours a day.

Unleashing the Power of Online Banking with Wema.

Easy access to your account(s) from anywhere in the world.

Online real-time account monitoring facility.

The convenience of conducting banking transactions from the comfort of home/office.

Guaranteed security for all your online transactions.

Easy Access to bank information and products.

An effective, cheaper, and easier way for our customers to communicate with banks.

Wema Bank offers a wide range of Digital Solution products designed to cater to different needs, from personal finance management (ALAT) to business payment collections (Paydirect) and even industry-specific solutions like hospital and school management.

Streamline your school operations and empower informed decision-making with Wema Bank's comprehensive School Management solution.

Streamline your business operations and boost sales with Wema Bank's innovative Wema POS terminals, your one-stop shop for secure and convenient payments.

WemaCollect is our cutting-edge solution that can be customised to meet your specific revenue collection needs. The solution is a robust real-time and highly secure electronic collection solution.

Boost your sales and simplify collections with AlatPay, Wema Bank's secure and flexible online payment gateway.

WemaRemitYour secure and efficient e-courier service for delivering funds and schedules to bank accounts and relevant bodies.

Customers can carry out banking transactions by simply dialing the short code *945# to experience an array of functions which include checking account balances on the Go, Quick funds transfer, Instant self and third party airtime recharge, bills payment and many more via their mobile phones.

We at Wema bank understand the need to connect Nigerians in Diaspora with their loved ones here at home and vice-versa, that is why our customers can enjoy the Send and Receive options via Western Union Money Transfer from all our branches nationwide. Our services are convenient, fast and secure.

MoneyGram transfer service is available in all Wema Bank branches. We have a solid partnership with MoneyGram which allows our customers the luxury of collecting their payments from friends and family in approximately 350,000 locations in over 200 countries all over the world.

With Wema Bank’s MoneyGram services, you are assured of receiving your money in our branches nation-wide from Monday to Friday. The product is uniquely designed to allow both customers and non-customers of Wema Bank receive and send funds.

title: WEMA Bank Western Union - Reliable Global Money Transfer Services
meta_description: Trust WEMA Bank's Western Union Money Transfer services for reliable and secure global transactions. Send and receive money with confidence, connecting with loved ones worldwide.
paragraphs: Do you know you can receive or send money directly from your account abroad with our western union money transfer? Yes, you can! Take advantage now!
US Dollars Payout either as Cash Pick up or directly into your Bank account – it is entirely your choice
You can receive Money Transfer in US Dollars directly into your Wema bank Domiciliary account or over the counter at any Wema Bank branch nationwide. Tap into this opportunity.

We at Wema bank understand the need to connect Nigerians in Diaspora with their loved ones here at home and vice-versa, that is why our customers can enjoy the Send and Receive options via Western Union Money Transfer from all our branches nationwide. This service enables people to send & receive money from over 250 countries through Agent locations worldwide using its web-based application.

Western Union and Wema Bank also have an exciting new service called Account Based Money Transfer (ABMT) which allows you receive funds directly into your Wema Bank account via the Bank’s Internet banking platform and digital banking platform, ALAT App.
Requirements to Receive

headings.text: Unleash the Power of Online Sales with Wema Web Pay

How does this work for a cardholder?

paragraphs: We are glad to introduce to you our aggregated online payment solution that accepts both local and international cards for payment of goods and services called Wema WebPay.

It is a payment engine integrated into merchants’ websites to receive payments from cardholders (MasterCard, Visa, Verve, etc.) paying with their cards online for goods and services after which the merchant receives value in his account when payment is made.
It is an online processing platform that enables businesses with or without functional websites to accept card payments from customers globally.

It ensures that your business can accept payments conveniently on its website from customers all over the world. With Wema WebPay, your website will also have the functionality of monitoring and viewing consolidated reports of transactions irrespective of channels.
Bank Verification Number – Code To Check Your BVN
Loan Rate Calculators – Mortgage, Car Loan or Any Loan

We are glad to introduce to you our aggregated online payment solution that accepts both local and international cards for payment of goods and services called Wema WebPay.It is a payment engine integrated into merchants’ websites to receive payments from cardholders (MasterCard, Visa, Verve, etc.) paying with their cards online for goods and services after which the merchant receives value in his account when payment is made.It is an online processing platform that enables businesses with or without functional websites to accept card payments from customers globally.It ensures that your business can accept payments conveniently on its website from customers all over the world. With Wema WebPay, your website will also have the functionality of monitoring and viewing consolidated reports of transactions irrespective of channels.How does this work for a merchant?- Merchant signs payment integration forms for Wema WebPay.- APIs will be exchanged between Wema Bank and the customer’s web developer as part of the integration process .- Following the completion of integration and successful testing of the payment engine on the website, payments by customers can commence.- Merchant is provided with a reporting console to view transactions as they occur online in real time.- Merchant’s account is credited for payments made on her websiteHow does this work for a cardholder?- The customer visits the Merchant’s website and adds desired items to the shopping cart.- The customer selects a card type or Internet Bank to pay with.- The shopping cart links to the payment interface for the selected card type.- The customer securely keys in card information with other required security details.- Once payment is successful, an online receipt is displayed on-screen and can be printed by the Customer.Features- Accepts local and international cards- A single integration connects a website to MasterCard, Visa, Verve, and Internet Banking of Nigerian BanksBenefits to Customer- An easy way of turning a website into a transactional e-commerce platform.- Alternative payment channel with convenience.- Wider customer reach as online presence and payment with cards lead to increased sales.- The economy now demands card payment as a preferred option to cash with large handling charges for individuals and companies who withdraw and pay large volumes of cash.- Reduces risks of theft and other risks associated with cash handling.- Robust reporting tools for online real-time transaction monitoring- Real-time online processing of transactions i.e. instant debit of cardholder’s account immediately after payment is made.- Payment is received by merchants within 24 hours.- Highly secured by 3D secure code and VbV (Verify by Visa).- Flexibility of making payments for goods & services via Internet Banking is very secure due to adequate network and enterprise security built into the system by the Bank.Documentation- Maintenance of an account with Wema Bank.- Completed Application form(Click here to download application form).- Existing website (Wema also has an arrangement in place if non-existing).- Working with your existing website developer.    Apply Now

We are glad to introduce to you our aggregated online payment solution that accepts both local and international cards for payment of goods and services called Wema WebPay.It is a payment engine integrated into merchants’ websites to receive payments from cardholders (MasterCard, Visa, Verve, etc.) paying with their cards online for goods and services after which the merchant receives value in his account when payment is made.It is an online processing platform that enables businesses with or without functional websites to accept card payments from customers globally.It ensures that your business can accept payments conveniently on its website from customers all over the world. With Wema WebPay, your website will also have the functionality of monitoring and viewing consolidated reports of transactions irrespective of channels.

How does this work for a merchant?- Merchant signs payment integration forms for Wema WebPay.- APIs will be exchanged between Wema Bank and the customer’s web developer as part of the integration process .- Following the completion of integration and successful testing of the payment engine on the website, payments by customers can commence.- Merchant is provided with a reporting console to view transactions as they occur online in real time.- Merchant’s account is credited for payments made on her website

How does this work for a cardholder?- The customer visits the Merchant’s website and adds desired items to the shopping cart.- The customer selects a card type or Internet Bank to pay with.- The shopping cart links to the payment interface for the selected card type.- The customer securely keys in card information with other required security details.- Once payment is successful, an online receipt is displayed on-screen and can be printed by the Customer.
Features- Accepts local and international cards- A single integration connects a website to MasterCard, Visa, Verve, and Internet Banking of Nigerian Banks

Benefits to Customer- An easy way of turning a website into a transactional e-commerce platform.- Alternative payment channel with convenience.- Wider customer reach as online presence and payment with cards lead to increased sales.- The economy now demands card payment as a preferred option to cash with large handling charges for individuals and companies who withdraw and pay large volumes of cash.- Reduces risks of theft and other risks associated with cash handling.- Robust reporting tools for online real-time transaction monitoring- Real-time online processing of transactions i.e. instant debit of cardholder’s account immediately after payment is made.- Payment is received by merchants within 24 hours.- Highly secured by 3D secure code and VbV (Verify by Visa).- Flexibility of making payments for goods & services via Internet Banking is very secure due to adequate network and enterprise security built into the system by the Bank.

Documentation- Maintenance of an account with Wema Bank.- Completed Application form(Click here to download application form).- Existing website (Wema also has an arrangement in place if non-existing).- Working with your existing website developer.    Apply Now
lists: - Merchant signs payment integration forms for Wema WebPay.
- APIs will be exchanged between Wema Bank and the customer’s web developer as part of the integration process .
- Following the completion of integration and successful testing of the payment engine on the website, payments by customers can commence.
- Merchant is provided with a reporting console to view transactions as they occur online in real time.
- Merchant’s account is credited for payments made on her website
- The customer visits the Merchant’s website and adds desired items to the shopping cart.
- The customer selects a card type or Internet Bank to pay with.
- The shopping cart links to the payment interface for the selected card type.
- The customer securely keys in card information with other required security details.
- Once payment is successful, an online receipt is displayed on-screen and can be printed by the Customer.
- Accepts local and international cards
- A single integration connects a website to MasterCard, Visa, Verve, and Internet Banking of Nigerian Banks
- An easy way of turning a website into a transactional e-commerce platform.
- Alternative payment channel with convenience.
- Wider customer reach as online presence and payment with cards lead to increased sales.
- The economy now demands card payment as a preferred option to cash with large handling charges for individuals and companies who withdraw and pay large volumes of cash.
- Reduces risks of theft and other risks associated with cash handling.
- Robust reporting tools for online real-time transaction monitoring
- Real-time online processing of transactions i.e. instant debit of cardholder’s account immediately after payment is made.
- Payment is received by merchants within 24 hours.
- Highly secured by 3D secure code and VbV (Verify by Visa).
- Flexibility of making payments for goods & services via Internet Banking is very secure due to adequate network and enterprise security built into the system by the Bank.
- Maintenance of an account with Wema Bank.
- Completed Application form(Click here to download application form).
- Existing website (Wema also has an arrangement in place if non-existing).

title: WEMA Bank Prestige Banking - Tailored for Your Financial Success

headings.text: Exclusive Privileges Await with Wema Prestige Banking
What benefits does Prestige Banking offer?
What type of card does Prestige banking offer?
What types of accounts are available under Prestige Banking?
How do I become a Prestige Banking client?
Is my information kept confidential with Prestige Banking?
Can I access Prestige Banking services online or through mobile banking?
How can I contact the Prestige Banking team for assistance?
How can I learn more about Prestige Banking offerings and benefits?

paragraphs: We are committed to providing a suite of banking products, investment services, and a range of unparalleled services to enhance your lifestyle. Opening the right account is one of the best decisions you can make for now and the future because you are guaranteed the safety of your funds with attractive interest.
True luxury is designing a life that allows you to do what you want, when you want.
We anticipate your needs and provide perfect solutions-you never have to ask!
With Wema Bank, enjoy ease, live the premium life, get more with less effort.
Enjoy less cost and more profit, get discounted rates on loans and investments.
Discover the ultimate banking experience – tailor-made wealth management, elite lifestyle perks, and comprehensive financial solutions designed for you.
Be a Prestige Visa Signature client & unlock a world of perks: Lounges, travel insurance, warranties & more!
Our dedicated team partners with you to craft a financial plan – savings, investments, and more!
Access to our partners benefits, premium services for less, discounts at spa hotels, restaurants, PTA requests, Flight booking, and more!
With ALAT, you will be able to process bill payments, make fund transfers with ease, and do so much more.
Skip the line! 24/7 support, priority service & savings on products.
With Bancassurance, we connect you with insurance companies for lifestyle, financial, and personal risk protection solutions.
Through our exclusive events, seminars, and webinars on financial topics and investment trends, you will be able to connect with HNIs.
Gain access to customized credit solutions with advantageous pricing, whether it's for expanding your business or acquiring assets.
Explore a suite of high-yield savings accounts and investment options that maximize returns.
Prestige Current Account (PCA): This is an account targeted at decerning High net worth individuals who require personalized financial service and lifestyle advantage.

The Domiciliary current account is designed to enable you carry out local and international transactions from the comfort of your home, office or abroad. The account is denominated in Euros, Pounds and Dollars

The Naira Platinum Debit Card is a unique card tailored to our for Prestige Current Account Holders   with exclusive access to premium benefits beyond the standard Naira MasterCard. This includes a   mix of higher transaction limits, discount offers/rewards etc.
Gain access to exceptional spending power with a wide range of exclusive privileges   and rewards.

MoneyGram transfer service is available in all Wema Bank branches. We have a solid partnership with MoneyGram which allows our customers the luxury of collecting their payments from friends and family in approximately 350,000 locations in over 200 countries all over the world.
